title: Lead 3D Artist
content:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.Lead 3D Artist | Helsinki or Berlin
Neon Koi were formed in 2020 by industry veterans from studios such as; Rockstar, Insomniac, Supercell, Wargaming and Rovio. In 2022 we joined Playstation, making Neon Koi the founding studio of the PlayStation Studios Mobile Division.
Our Mission is to make action games with epic stories to foster lasting connections with players around the world. We’re fearlessly exploring bold new ideas with the aim to make high-quality, visually stunning games for mobile devices.
 
Why do our people love it here?
Games - We live and breathe games, playing together regularly and having games at the heart of everything we do. We prioritise our players and deeply understand them, which drives everything we do
People - Are Powerful Together, we believe that excellence is reached through team collaboration and a culture of feedback. We’re made up of passionate, collaborative and humble people.  We’re committed to hiring a diverse team and we believe in treating people fairly.  A great workplace is one where you feel like you belong. We are building a team of people who understand, empathise, collaborate, listen and connect. We want to create equal opportunity for all and give everyone a fair chance.
Pioneers - We’re pioneers. We aim to create AAA experiences that will push innovation and gaming on mobile. Think of everything you love about console games and imagine having that in the palm of your hand. You’ll be able to directly impact Neon Koi by joining us, early on in our mission.
Inspired -  Neon Koi is a perfect home for those looking to make great games. We're hiring professionals who believe their best work is yet to be done. If you want; to make an impact, have more autonomy, bring AAA to mobile and want to work with a team of welcoming, open and honest teammates, Neon Koi is the place for you.
We’re committed to creating a diverse team. If you feel that you might be interested in the role, even if you don’t hit 100% of the criteria, please don’t let that put you off.  Get in touch with us. We believe in passion and potential. 
 
The Role: 
We are looking for a Lead 3D Artist to join our passionate team in Helsinki or Berlin. You should be proactive and have a strong motivation to lead your team of artists to create captivating and visually stunning games that engage players worldwide.
As the Lead 3D Artist, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the visual direction of our games and driving the artistic excellence of our projects.
You should have a strong understanding of creating environment 3D assets from versatile modular environment sets to unique hero assets. You’ll be working closely within a team of experienced game developers and have a significant impact on the final technical performance and quality of all 3D environment assets.
 
Responsibilities 


Lead and manage a team of talented 3D artists, providing guidance, feedback, and mentorship to foster their professional growth and optimise their creative output


Collaborate closely with Art Directors, Game Designers, and Technical Artists to define and execute the visual style and quality standards for our mobile games


Create and oversee the production of high-quality 3D assets, including characters, environments, props, and special effects, ensuring they meet the artistic vision and technical requirements of the projects


Create high-quality environment 3D assets according to our game’s requirements and vision while working closely with the Concept Artist to ensure the quality of the deliverables 


Communicate and collaborate with other teams to align and to plan and schedule 3D-asset productions 


Implement assets into Unreal Engine 5 and communicate with artists, designers and programmers 


Maintain a flexible iterative approach and research and share knowledge of 3D asset techniques and game development work practices


Offer feedback, support team morale and facilitate free and open creative communication


Manage outsourced teams of 3D artists by briefing and guiding them and reviewing their work


Experiment and research alongside Technical department and Art direction enabling better world-building and visual choices 


Required Skills 


5+ years of experience in 3D environment art for game development 


Previous managerial or team leadership experience 


Strong expertise creating environment 3D asset props and versatile modular environment asset sets


Strong artistic understanding of shape, composition and colour, excited to work within a stylised art style 


Portfolio examples of beautiful environment assets you have made that show your understanding of form, composition and colour 


Strong proficiency in 3D and 2D content creation tools of your choice 


Strong technical understanding of game engines and awareness of the performance and optimization and good problem solving ability in 3D asset related technical issues 


Experience in analysing and maintaining performance and visual fidelity of the environments 


Desirable Skills 


Unreal Engine 5 experience 


Experience in mobile game development 


Traditional art skills and passion for art in general 


Deeper interest in architecture and nature as a visual inspiration
 


Why join us?
Although we’re a new company, we’re committed to making this a great place to work, so this is only the beginning of our benefits:


Annual bonus


Paid lunches 


Budget towards commuting costs


Gym or sporting subscription to spend as you wish


Home internet or mobile data plan provided


Educational budget: for language learning, self-training, attending conferences, buying games and books etc


Financial and practical assistance with relocation through our relocation partner and a relocation budget


Twice yearly off-sites, this year we held one in Berlin and one in Helsinki


PBG - Pizza, beer and games on the last Friday of every month


30 days holiday plus additional days from Christmas and New Year


Discounts on PlayStation products and games


We're an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Equal Opportunity Statement:
Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.
We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.
PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

demographic_questions.description:
Sony Interactive Entertainment Europe Limited (‘SIEE’) is committed to ensuring that all job applicants and members of staff are treated equally, without discrimination because of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, gender reassignment, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, disability or age. Collecting diversity data is intended to help SIEE maintain equal opportunities best practice and identify barriers to workforce equality and diversity. Please read this notification and consent before you decide whether to submit your diversity data in the survey below. 

SIEE will treat all survey responses in the strictest confidence, and our personnel with decision-making role in the recruitment process can only see aggregated reports on the results of the survey and cannot allocate these aggregated reports to individual applicants. There is no obligation on you to provide diversity data, SIEE will treat all applicants the same regardless of whether they provide diversity data or not, and any responses to the survey will not affect our decision on your application.

You can withdraw your consent at any time. The withdrawal of your consent does not affect the lawfulness of the processing of your diversity data based on your consent before its withdrawal.
